item.title: A. add a quote by Margaret Landon
item.description: "Most people do not see the world as it is. They see it as they are" -- Margaret Landon

item.title: A. add a quote by Margaret Landon
item.description: "If love was a choice, who would ever choose such exquisite pain?" -- Margaret Landon

item.title: A. add a quote by Margaret Landon
item.description: "When a woman who has much to say says nothing, her silence can be deafening." -- Margaret Landon

item.title: A. add a quote by أحلام مستغانمي
item.description: "أجمل حب هو الذي نعثر عليه أثناء بحثنا عن شيء آخر" -- أحلام مستغانمي

item.title: A. add a quote by غسان كنفاني
item.description: "لن تستطيعي أن تجدي الشمس في غرفة مغلقة " -- غسان كنفاني

item.title: A. add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "Be with me always - take any form - drive me mad! only do not leave me in this abyss, where I cannot find you! Oh, God! it is unutterable! I can not live without my life! I can not live without my soul!" -- Emily Brontë

item.title: A. add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: A. add a quote by Henry van Dyke
item.description: "Time is Too Slow for those who Wait, Too Swift for those who Fear, Too Long for those who Grieve, Too Short for those who Rejoice; But for those who Love, Time is not." -- Henry van Dyke

item.title: A. add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: A. add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "I love the ground under his feet, and the air over his head, and everything he touches and every word he says. I love all his looks, and all his actions and him entirely and all together." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: A. add a quote by Edmond Rostand
item.description: "A kiss, when all is said, what is it? A rosy dot placed on the "i" in loving; 'tis a secret told to the mouth instead of to the ear." -- Edmond Rostand

item.title: A. add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Life is pure adventure, and the sooner we realize that, the quicker we will be able to treat life as art." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: A. add a quote by Dolly Parton
item.description: "If your actions create a legacy that inspires others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, then, you are an excellent leader." -- Dolly Parton

item.title: A. add a quote by غادة السمان
item.description:
"ها قد عدت أيها الرجل الخطر لتثير شهيتي إلى الأخلاص
وهذا يقلقني" -- غادة السمان

item.title: A. add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "You gave too much rein to your imagination. Imagination is a good servant, and a bad master. The simplest explanation is always the most likely." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: A. add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Why, man, he doth bestride the narrow world Like a Colossus; and we petty men Walk under his huge legs, and peep about To find ourselves dishonourable graves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: A. add a quote by غادة السمان
item.description: "أين كنت ذلك المساء حين شاهدت آخر عود ثقاب في العالم ينطفيء وكنت وحدي؟" -- غادة السمان

item.title: A. add a quote by غادة السمان
item.description: "والحب كما يمارسونه هو دور من إثنين: دور الجلاد ودور الضحية وكل ما نملكه هو أن نختار أي الأدوار أقرب إلى حقيقتنا الداخلية" -- غادة السمان

item.title: A. add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: A. add a quote by غادة السمان
item.description: "آه, خذ قلبي وأقضمه كتفاحة ولكن لا تسجنني داخل دائرة مقفلة" -- غادة السمان

item.title: A. add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "You can conquer almost any fear if you will only make up your mind to do so. For remember, fear doesn't exist anywhere except in the mind." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: A. add a quote by أحلام مستغانمي
item.description: "أحسد الأطفال الرضّع، لأنهم يملكون وحدهم حق الصراخ والقدرة عليه، قبل أن تروض الحياة حبالهم الصوتية، وتعلِّمهم الصمت" -- أحلام مستغانمي

item.title: A. add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have. The older she gets, the more interested he is in her." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: A. add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "Knowledge isn’t power until it is applied." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: A. add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: A. add a quote by Kahlil Jibran
item.description: "The reality of the other person lies not in what he reveals to you, but what he cannot reveal to you. Therefore, if you would understand him, listen not to what he says, but rather to what he does not say." -- Kahlil Jibran

item.title: A. add a quote by William Shakespeare
A. add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: A. add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: A. add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci
